algorithm_technique: Cycle detection (DFS/traversal), BFS for chain extensions
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum number of employees who can sit at a round table, each next to their favorite person.
problem_summary_technical: Model as a directed graph where edges are favorite preferences. Find longest cycles and chains attached to 2-cycles.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding cycles and paths in a functional graph (each node has out-degree 1).
Employees can only sit together if they form cycles or specific structures around 2-cycles.
Longest cycles of length > 2 contribute directly. For length 2 cycles, we can attach chains of employees.
